replies.bodyText:
Yes, but we'll need three files for each dual screen activities.

Not spanned.
Spanned - horizontal.
Spanned - vertical.

NOTE: after getting this feedback, I realized that the current solution can be made more reusable. Therefore, I made a change to do the following.

Created a 'dual_screen_layout.xml'.


Internally, this contains the 'content' area, and the 'blank' area.


Moved adjustLayout() to DualScreenUtil.


This function now takes an activity that uses 'dual_screen_layout.xml'.
Based on the screen state, it will adjust the 'content' and the 'blank' area appropriately.


Any page that needs to support duo will have to do the following


call setContentView(R.layout.dual_screen_layout);
attach its 'content to be displayed' to the 'content' area of dual_screen_layout.xml.

This could be a fragment, or a ViewGroup (inflated from another layout)


call DualScreenUtil.adjustLayoutForDualScreenActivity().

This means I'll be able to reuse this with AuthorizationActivity (Broker/MSAL),  AuthenticationActivity (ADAL), AccountChooserActivity (Broker) and any other Broker pages that might have to support Duo in the future.
